In the days preceding November 14, Oakland Police delivered 'notices of violations' to Frank Ogawa plaza. In the early hours of November 14, approximately 700-1000 police were mobilized. Supporters began arriving, and and a line of union workers wearing white arm bands formed a line to observe and mediate if necessary.<ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 Oakland Tribune live blog at 11 a.m. âTeacher observes sceneâ ]</ref>. At approximately 4:30 AM, police entered the plaza. Police initially made about 20 arrests, 14 of whom had been praying all night in the campâs inter faith tent.<ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 Oakland Tribune live blog at 6:30 am am - "About 20 arrested so far"]</ref>. Afterwards, police demolished the camp.
In the days preceding November 14, Oakland Police delivered 'notices of violations' to Frank Ogawa plaza. In the early hours of November 14, approximately 700-1000 police were mobilized. Supporters began arriving, and and a line of union workers wearing white arm bands formed a line to observe and mediate if necessary.<ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 Oakland Tribune live blog at 11 a.m. âTeacher observes sceneâ ]</ref>. At approximately 4:30 AM, police entered the plaza. Police initially made about 20 arrests, 14 of whom had been praying all night in the campâs inter faith tent.<ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 Oakland Tribune live blog at 6:30 am am - "About 20 arrested so far"]</ref>. Afterwards, police demolished the camp.
â
[[Daniel Mark Siegel|Dan Siegel]], Mayor Jean Quan's city hall Legal Adviser, resigned in protest, announcing, via Facebook: "No longer Mayor Quan's legal adviser. Resigned at 2 am. Support Occupy Oakland, not the 1% and its government facilitators."<ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 Oakland Tribune live blog at 7:20 am - "Mayor's legal adviser quits over police raid"]</ref>
+
[[Daniel Mark Siegel|Dan Siegel]], Mayor Jean Quan's city hall Legal Adviser, resigned in protest, announcing, via Facebook: "No longer Mayor Quan's legal adviser. Resigned at 2 am. Support Occupy Oakland, not the 1% and its government facilitators."<ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 Oakland Tribune live blog at 7:20 am - "Mayor's legal adviser quits over police raid"]</ref> That same day, Oakland Deputy Mayor [[Sharon Cornu]] resigned her post as well. <ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/occupy-oakland/ci_19331752 Mercury News] <ref>
